summary: Older adults and people with disabilities can generally be vulnerable to financial distress, so it's important to help them understand and manage their finances. We found 24 examples of federal financial literacy programs for these groups, such as a curriculum for teaching older adults about scams and financial information for people with disabilities. A federal commission coordinates federal financial literacy efforts—but its reports aren't clear...
title: Financial Literacy: Better Outcome Reporting Could Facilitate Oversight of Programs for Older Adults and People with Disabilities
